      • setProcessArchivesAsDirectories

        void setProcessArchivesAsDirectories(boolean b)
        When we encounter a zip or tgz file, do we descend into it like it was a directory? Note that for accessing large ZIP files, you need Java 7 which supports the ZIP64 format, otherwise you'll get the "invalid CEN header (bad signature)" error.
        Parameters:
        b - if true, treats zipfiles like a directory and processes all the files inside

      • setRecurseSubdirs

        void setRecurseSubdirs(boolean recurseSubdirs)
        Should we recursively index files in subdirectories (and archives files, if that setting is on)?
        Parameters:
        recurseSubdirs - true if we should recurse into subdirs

      • setFormatIdentifier

        void setFormatIdentifier(String formatIdentifier)
                  throws DocumentFormatNotFound
        Throws:
        DocumentFormatNotFound

      • setListener

        void setListener(IndexListener listener)
        Set the listener object that receives messages about indexing progress.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener object to report to

      • listener

        IndexListener listener()
        Get our index listener, or create a console reporting listener if none was set yet. Also reports the creation of the Indexer and start of indexing, if it hadn't been reported already.
        Returns:
        the listener

      • setMaxNumberOfDocsToIndex

        void setMaxNumberOfDocsToIndex(int n)
        Set number of documents after which we should stop. Useful when testing.
        Parameters:
        n - number of documents after which to stop

      • rollback

        void rollback()
        Call this to roll back any changes made to the index this session. Calling close() will automatically commit any changes. If you call this method, then call close(), no changes will be committed.

      • close

        void close()
        Close the index

      • isClosed

        @Deprecated
boolean isClosed()
        Deprecated. changed to isOpen to match Lucene
        Returns:
        true iff indexer is closed

      • isOpen

        boolean isOpen()
        Is this indexer open? An indexer can be closed unexpectedly if e.g. the GC overhead limit is exceeded.
        Returns:
        true if the indexer is open, false if not

      • update

        void update(org.apache.lucene.index.Term term,
            org.apache.lucene.document.Document document)
     throws IOException
        Updates the specified Document in the index.
        Parameters:
        term - how to find the document to update
        document - the updated document
        Throws:
        IOException

      • index

        void index(String documentName,
           InputStream input)
        Index a document or archive from an InputStream.
        Parameters:
        documentName - name for the InputStream (e.g. name of the file)
        input - the stream

      • index

        void index(String documentName,
           Reader reader)
    throws IOException,
           MalformedInputFile,
           PluginException
        Index a document from a Reader. NOTE: it is generally better to supply an (UTF-8) InputStream or byte array directly, as this can in some cases be parsed more efficiently (e.g. using VTD-XML). Catches and reports any errors that occur.
        Parameters:
        documentName - some (preferably unique) name for this document (for example, the file name or path)
        reader - where to index from
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurred
        MalformedInputFile - if the input file was invalid
        PluginException - if an error in a plugin occurred

      • index

        void index(String fileName,
           InputStream input,
           String fileNameGlob)
        Index a document (or archive if enabled by setProcessArchivesAsDirectories(boolean)
        Parameters:
        fileName -
        input -
        fileNameGlob -

      • index

        void index(File file)
        Index the file or directory specified. Indexes all files in a directory or archive (previously only indexed *.xml; specify a glob if you want this behaviour back, see index(File, String). Recurses into subdirs only if that setting is enabled.
        Parameters:
        file - the input file or directory

      • index

        void index(File file,
           String fileNameGlob)
        Index a document, archive (if enabled by setProcessArchivesAsDirectories(boolean), or directory, optionally recursively if set by setRecurseSubdirs(boolean)
        Parameters:
        file -
        fileNameGlob - only files

        Set parameters we would like to be passed to the DocIndexer class
        Parameters:
        indexerParam - the parameters

      • setLinkedFileDirs

        void setLinkedFileDirs(List<File> linkedFileDirs)
        Set the directories to search for linked files. DocIndexerXPath allows us to index a second file into the same Lucene document, which is useful for external metadata, etc. This determines how linked files are located.
        Parameters:
        linkedFileDirs - directories to search

      • setLinkedFileResolver

void setUseThreads(boolean useThreads)
